title: 107_s1656
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Benefits Administration Improvement Act of 2001". The Veterans Benefits Administration is responsible for processing veterans' compensation and pension claims accurately and timely. Concerns have been raised about the accuracy of claims processing, with new measurements showing lower accuracy rates than previously reported. Additionally, the Administration may face a significant loss of workforce due to retirement by 2003. The Veterans Benefits Administration faces challenges in accurately processing veterans' claims, with initial reviews being accurate only 64% of the time. There is a potential loss of up to 30% of its workforce to retirement by 2003, highlighting the need for adequate training for claims adjudicators. The Administration must take more aggressive steps to ensure timely and accurate processing of claims to avoid delays in providing compensation and pension benefits to veterans. The expected appeals processing time for a claim is 621 days, and as of September 2001, there was a backlog of 533,029 claims. SEC. 3. IMPROVEMENT OF PROCESSING OF VETERANS BENEFITS CLAIMS. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a plan for improving claims processing within 90 days of this Act. The plan should focus on training adjudicators, enhancing accountability standards, and identifying recurring errors to avoid delays in benefit payments. The plan for improving claims processing includes mechanisms to strengthen the Veterans Benefits Administration's ability to identify recurring errors in claims adjudications, implement a system for reviewing claims processing accuracy, and evaluate the impact of training. The plan for improving claims processing includes mechanisms for evaluating the impact of the Training and Performance Support System on accuracy and consistency, as well as quantifiable goals for these mechanisms. The Secretary must consult with veterans organizations and other parties in developing the plan, which will be implemented 60 days after submission and can be modified if needed. The Secretary shall implement the plan for improving claims processing 60 days after submission. The plan can be modified with proper notification, and reports assessing its implementation must be submitted every six months. The Secretary must submit a report every six months assessing the implementation of the plan for improving claims processing, including whether the goals are being achieved. Funding for the plan will come from appropriations for the Veterans Benefits Administration.
